definition: a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
outside/in addition/foreign/external
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
branch/classifier for sticks, rods, pencils etc

sentences.english: An agreement was about to be reached when the other side raised new issues (or caused complications).
sentences.chinese: 快要达成协议时，对方又节外生枝。

sentences.english: Always there is something. Always someone will interfere.
sentences.chinese: 总是节外生枝，总是有人出面干涉。

sentences.english: A wise wife never gives her husband time to have second thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 聪明的老婆从不给老公有时间三思，省得节外生枝。
